Posts.EditableText: Proof that I am still a total Quest wanker. EDIT: haha... w@nker is filtered. Funny. I can't believe I haven't noticed this until now, but... I have a room where you can go northeast, south, and southwest. If I type 'n', I am moved to the northeast. What?!? I looked at the other rooms that have a northeast direction that do NOT have a north direction defined and the same applies. Does 'n' equal 'ne' if a north direction is not specified? Does this always happen? If so, how do I correct this? XanMag
Posts.HTML:
Proof that I am still a total Quest wanker. EDIT: haha... w@nker is filtered. Funny.

I can't believe I haven't noticed this until now, but...

I have a room where you can go northeast, south, and southwest. If I type 'n', I am moved to the northeast. What?!?

I looked at the other rooms that have a northeast direction that do NOT have a north direction defined and the same applies. Does 'n' equal 'ne' if a north direction is not specified?

Does this always happen? If so, how do I correct this?

XanMag

Posts.EditableText:
I reported this as a bug at one time, but apparently it is a feature.

For any command input, it checks first for exact matches, so if there is a north direction it matches "n". If it does not get a match, it looks for partial matches, and so matches "n" to "northeast".
Posts.HTML:
I reported this as a bug at one time, but apparently it is a feature.

For any command input, it checks first for exact matches, so if there is a north direction it matches "n". If it does not get a match, it looks for partial matches, and so matches "n" to "northeast".
